Package arcade.agent.module

Class Metabolism

java.lang.Object
arcade.agent.module.Metabolism
All Implemented Interfaces:
Module, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MetabolismComplex, MetabolismMedium, MetabolismRandom, MetabolismSimple
public abstract class Metabolism
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module
Implementation of Module for cell metabolism.

The Metabolism module:

  • gets available glucose and oxygen from the environment
  • calculates energy consumption (in ATP) given cell size and state
  • steps the metabolism module (implemented with different complexities) to determine changes to energy and volume
  • updates glucose and oxygen environment with consumption

All metabolism complexities use both the glycolysis and oxidative phosphorylation pathways to generate energy. Several stoichiometric ratios for glucose, oxygen, and pyruvate in glycolysis and oxidative phosphorylation are provided. Glucose and oxygen are numbered constants, codes may be added for additional molecules.

Since:
2.2
Version:
2.3.6
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Metabolism

      Metabolism​(Cell c, Simulation sim)
      Creates a Metabolism module for the given TissueCell.

      Module parameters are specific for the cell population. The module starts with energy at zero and assumes a constant ratio between mass and volume (through density).

      Parameters:
      c - the TissueCell the module is associated with
      sim - the simulation instance
